testcaseName: Zoster: Dose #2 (Shingrix) administered at 4 weeks - 1 days after dose #1
generalDescription: This test case describes when an adult patient is administered the second dose of Shingrix vaccine at 4 weeks - 1 day, that the dose is considered to be valid.
reasonForChange:
V4.0 Per SME Guidance, the four day grace period can be used. Second dose has been changed to "valid".
V3.5: Previous version was calculating the forecast from the first dose. This has been corrected to be from the previous dose (invalid dose #2).
